messages.content: Hi there, may you suggest me a week of meal options that I should cook? I want it to be enough meat, easy to cook, not much ingredient involved, not including oven or microwave.

Sure! Here are 7 easy to cook meat meal options for a week:
Monday:
* Grilled steak with mixed vegetables (such as carrots, onions, and bell peppers)
* Baked chicken with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
Tuesday:
* Grilled chicken breast with roasted peppers and brown rice
* Baked turkey breast with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
Wednesday:
* Grilled chicken breast with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
* Carne asada burrito with grilled chicken and cheese
Thursday:
* Grilled shrimp with mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes)
* Baked salmon with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
Friday:
* Grilled chicken with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
* Baked salmon with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
Saturday:
* Grilled chicken with mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes)
* Baked chicken with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
Sunday:
* Grilled salmon with mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes)
* Baked fish with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
I hope these meal options are helpful! Let me know if you have any other questions.
can you also show me how to cook them?

Sure! Here are the instructions for each of the 7 meat meal options:
Monday: Grilled steak with mixed vegetables
* Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Season the steak with salt and pepper. Place the steak on the grill and cook for about 5 minutes per side, or until the steak reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
* Remove the steak from the grill and slice into thin slices.
* Serve the steak with a salad or plenty of roasted vegetables.
Tuesday: Grilled chicken breast with roasted peppers and brown rice
* In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for about 5 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through.
* In a small bowl, mix together the roasted peppers, brown rice, and mascarpone cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
* Serve the chicken breasts and roasted peppers with the brown rice and roasted vegetables.
Wednesday: Grilled chicken breast with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans
* In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and roasted vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
* Serve the chicken breasts and roasted vegetables in a tortilla with cheese.
